column4: question: how can I limit a user to be able to only run one command and no others?
the bash shell has a 'restricted' mode (rbash) you can use to lock down a user VERY tightly.
depending on exactly what you want to do. that may or may not be what you need.
I'm creating an rsync backup account with an rsa pass file on my desktop.  Since that pass file has no password, I want to limit what my backup account can do to to just rsync
